alert.note: Alert for Upper Hood River Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 3:13PM PST until December 22 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...MORE SNOW ON THE WAY FOR THE CASCADES TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY... .Another storm system will take aim at the Cascades of Oregon and southwest Washington beginning overnight tonight and persisting through most of Wednesday. Heavy snow is expected at elevations above 3000 to 4000 feet. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Light freezing rain or a wintry mixture of precipitation expected. Total ice accumulations tonight and Wednesday morning are expected to be less than a tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Upper Hood River Valley. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 8 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Many roads, especially, bridges, overpasses, ramps, and other elevated surfaces, as well as sidewalks may become very slippery and extremely hazardous. Travel conditions could be difficult overnight tonight and Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down, allow extra following distance, and use caution while driving. Allow extra time to reach your destination. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
